page.title: 09The R.H.& Dymchurch Railway
page.content: In 1924 Captain Howey designed & built The Romney,Hythe & Dymchurch Railway. The Green Goddess engine was named after the star of Captain Howey's fav- ourite film.Now around 150,000 people use the railway a year.The track is 14.5 miles long.It has a 15.25 inch guage.There are 12 trains each about 5ft high and 220 ft long.Coal is the fuel.Each train can carry 200 people. The R.H.& D.R. employs 30 people doubling the number in the Summer.It is used to transport 80 - 100 school children from Dymchurch to Southlands Secondary School at New Romney.There are 5 stations.A return ticket from Hythe to Dungeness costs Â£4.65 for an adult & a third of the price for children.The trains can travel at 25 m.p.h.In 1985 an engine & 4 coaches are on exhibition in Japan.
